userPromptForThisRevision:
I want to create a modern Kickstarter-style web application for local government projects. The platform should allow citizens to browse, support, and track public initiatives — from community gardens and sports fields to infrastructure upgrades and cultural events.

The design should use a sleek, modern aesthetic with rounded corners, soft shadows, and a clean, minimalistic color palette (think pastel tones or soft gradients). Prioritize intuitive UX with clear call-to-action buttons like Donate, Share, and Track Progress.

Key features to include:
	•	Project listing with categories (environment, youth, sports, culture, infrastructure)
	•	Individual project pages with funding goals, description, images/videos, and donation progress bar
	•	User accounts to track donations and receive updates
	•	Admin dashboard for local government to post updates, approve projects, and monitor progress
	•	Optional gamification: top donors, community badges, or reward tiers

The webapp must be mobile-responsive and accessible, with smooth animations and a user-friendly interface. Ideally, the backend should allow easy integration with payment systems and government databases.

Main goal: Empower citizens to actively shape their community by supporting local projects through a beautifully designed, easy-to-use Kickstarter-inspired platform.
